issue.title: 3.0 Xml Output additions

milestone.title: Closed Without Action
milestone.description: This milestone contains closed issues where no action was taken. This includes questions, issues that could not be reproduced, rejected ideas, invalid issues, etc.

issue.body:
The current 3.0 Xml output includes the environment element which details the information about the version of the os and the verison of nunit used for the test.

It does not include any information about the test assembly/assemblies used for the tests.

It would seem very useful if the output included the full name of the tested assembly (which includes its version), and the created/modified date/time information.  Perhaps the load path for the assembly as well?

issue.title: Workers number in xml report file cannot be found
issue.body:
When run console with "--workers=4" parameter

```
nunit-console.exe InfraTests.dll  --workers=4
```

it shows the paremeter on display
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1849690/8669938/43255b14-2a21-11e5-9871-8ecf5db0447d.png)
but I cannot find the information (number of workers) in genereate report file "TestResult.xml".

Also, if user doesn't set number of workers, console "nunit-console.exe" doesn't show actual number of used workers.

body:
Here's a proposal for fixing this...

Include a new element `<settings>` under `<test-run>`.
Under `<settings>` include multiple `<setting>` elements.
Each `<setting>` element would have name and value attributes.
All package settings, as finally resolved in the engine, would be included. IOW, if the engine decided to use 5 worker threads, we would have

```
  <settings><setting name="NumberOfWorkers" value="5" />...</settings>
```

Comments?

@nunit/contributors @nunit/core-team @yetibrain
This won't go anywhere unless there are positive comments.
